definition: (archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms

sentences.english: It was my good fortune to be linked with Madame Curie through twenty years of sublime and unclouded friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我幸運地同居裏夫人有20年崇高而真摯的友誼。

sentences.english: When you cohabit , it adds a sense of commitment to a relationship that is going nowhere.
sentences.chinese: 同居讓一段難以有進展的關係又多了一層約束力。

sentences.english: Co-habitation prior to marriage may exert a series of distressing effects.
sentences.chinese: 未婚同居產生了一系列令人擔憂的後果。

sentences.english: But the reality is that dissolution rates are higher among cohabiting couples than remarried couples.
sentences.chinese: 現實是同居配偶的解散率高於再婚配偶。

sentences.english: But those who live together before marriage are more likely to divorce.
sentences.chinese: 但是那些婚前同居的人更有可能離婚。

sentences.english: Meantime, the number of unmarried cohabiting couples has grown tenfold, the census shows.
sentences.chinese: 同時未婚同居的情侶增加了10倍。

sentences.english: His long period of association with Jennie had made him incautious .
sentences.chinese: 他因跟珍妮同居日久，已經什麼事都大意了。

sentences.english: A couple can privately prove their commitment to one another by cohabiting.
sentences.chinese: 一對伴侶可以通過同居來私下表明他們對彼此的承諾。

sentences.english: College students should be allowed to cohabit.
sentences.chinese: 大學生應該被允許同居。

sentences.english: It provides the most detailed data on cohabitation of men and women to date.
sentences.chinese: 這份資料提供了男女未婚同居的最詳盡的數據。

sentences.english: I believe that co-habitation makes young blood more successful.
sentences.chinese: 我相信同居會使年輕人更成功。

sentences.english: Small grand drives away Xiao Ya instantly, live together with big house rise.
sentences.chinese: 小浩立即趕走肖雅，與大宇同居起來。
上帝發明同居，撒旦發明婚姻。

sentences.english: I require cohabitating couples to separate during the engagement.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲在訂婚前同居男女需要分開一段時間。

sentences.english: With the increasing acceptance of cohabitation, why remarry?
sentences.chinese: 伴隨更多同居被接受，爲什麼要再婚？

sentences.english: In my long-term relationships, cohabitation has always been the stumbling block.
sentences.chinese: 在我的一些長期的戀愛中，同居總是最出問題的環節。

definition: to have sexual relations with sb/to have dealings with
to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
trial marriage/to live together before deciding whether to marry
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to fall head over heels in love/to be passionately in love
to part company/to split up/to break up
